trans-unit.source: Understand operations by using reports | Microsoft Intune
trans-unit.target: Understand operations by using reports | Microsoft Intune

trans-unit.source: Create and manage reports about software, hardware, and software licenses in your organization.
trans-unit.target: Create and manage reports about software, hardware, and software licenses in your organization.

trans-unit.source: Understand Microsoft Intune operations by using reports
trans-unit.target: Understand Microsoft Intune operations by using reports

trans-unit.source: Use the information in this topic to help you create and manage Microsoft Intune reports that provide information about software, hardware, and software licenses in your organization.
trans-unit.target: Use the information in this topic to help you create and manage Microsoft Intune reports that provide information about software, hardware, and software licenses in your organization.

trans-unit.source: Using reports
trans-unit.target: Using reports

trans-unit.source: Intune reports provide information about software, hardware, and software licenses in your organization.
trans-unit.target: Intune reports provide information about software, hardware, and software licenses in your organization.

trans-unit.source: Reports can help you confirm current needs and forecast future spending.
trans-unit.target: Reports can help you confirm current needs and forecast future spending.

trans-unit.source: The **Reports** workspace gives you the tools to create and manage reports.
trans-unit.target: The **Reports** workspace gives you the tools to create and manage reports.

trans-unit.source: Report types
trans-unit.target: Report types

trans-unit.source: Report type
trans-unit.target: Report type

trans-unit.source: Description
trans-unit.target: Description

trans-unit.source: Update Reports
trans-unit.target: Update Reports

trans-unit.source: Show the software updates that succeeded on computers in your organization.
trans-unit.target: Show the software updates that succeeded on computers in your organization.

trans-unit.source: They also show the updates that failed, are pending, or are needed.
trans-unit.target: They also show the updates that failed, are pending, or are needed.

trans-unit.source: For more information on software updates, see [Keep Windows PCs up to date with software updates in Microsoft Intune](keep-windows-pcs-up-to-date-with-software-updates-in-microsoft-intune.md).
trans-unit.target: For more information on software updates, see [Keep Windows PCs up to date with software updates in Microsoft Intune](keep-windows-pcs-up-to-date-with-software-updates-in-microsoft-intune.md).

trans-unit.source: Detected Software reports
trans-unit.target: Detected Software reports

trans-unit.source: Show software that is installed on computers in your organization.
trans-unit.target: Show software that is installed on computers in your organization.

trans-unit.source: Software versions are included.
trans-unit.target: Software versions are included.

trans-unit.source: You can filter the information that displays based on the software publisher and the software category.
trans-unit.target: You can filter the information that displays based on the software publisher and the software category.

trans-unit.source: You can expand the updates in the list to show more detail (such as the computers on which an update is installed) by choosing the directional arrow next to the list item.
trans-unit.target: You can expand the updates in the list to show more detail (such as the computers on which an update is installed) by choosing the directional arrow next to the list item.

trans-unit.source: When you retire computers or change their group memberships in Intune, it can take several minutes for these changes to be reflected in the Detected Software report.
trans-unit.target: When you retire computers or change their group memberships in Intune, it can take several minutes for these changes to be reflected in the Detected Software report.

trans-unit.source: For the most accurate software inventory data, wait a few minutes after retiring computers or changing their group memberships before you run a detected software report that includes those computers.
trans-unit.target: For the most accurate software inventory data, wait a few minutes after retiring computers or changing their group memberships before you run a detected software report that includes those computers.

trans-unit.source: Computer Inventory Reports
trans-unit.target: Computer Inventory Reports

trans-unit.source: Show information about managed computers in your organization.
trans-unit.target: Show information about managed computers in your organization.

trans-unit.source: Use this report to plan hardware purchases and to understand more about the hardware needs of users in your organization.
trans-unit.target: Use this report to plan hardware purchases and to understand more about the hardware needs of users in your organization.

trans-unit.source: For more information on working with managed computers, see [Manage Windows PCs with Microsoft Intune](manage-windows-pcs-with-microsoft-intune.md).
trans-unit.target: For more information on working with managed computers, see [Manage Windows PCs with Microsoft Intune](manage-windows-pcs-with-microsoft-intune.md).

trans-unit.source: Mobile Device Inventory Reports
trans-unit.target: Mobile Device Inventory Reports

trans-unit.source: Show information about the mobile devices in your organization.
trans-unit.target: Show information about the mobile devices in your organization.

trans-unit.source: You can filter the information that displays based on groups, whether the device is a jailbroken or rooted device, and by operating system.
trans-unit.target: You can filter the information that displays based on groups, whether the device is a jailbroken or rooted device, and by operating system.

trans-unit.source: License Purchase Reports
trans-unit.target: License Purchase Reports

trans-unit.source: Show the software titles for all licensed software in selected license groups, based on their licensing agreements.
trans-unit.target: Show the software titles for all licensed software in selected license groups, based on their licensing agreements.

trans-unit.source: If software license information has not refreshed in more than 24 hours, it will refresh when you generate a license report.
trans-unit.target: If software license information has not refreshed in more than 24 hours, it will refresh when you generate a license report.

trans-unit.source: A license report is not an exact calculation of software titles that are being used, or proof of compliance with agreements.
trans-unit.target: A license report is not an exact calculation of software titles that are being used, or proof of compliance with agreements.

trans-unit.source: The report is a tool to help you make licensing decisions for your organization.
trans-unit.target: The report is a tool to help you make licensing decisions for your organization.

trans-unit.source: Intune might not detect some products that are able to have a Microsoft volume license.
trans-unit.target: Intune might not detect some products that are able to have a Microsoft volume license.

trans-unit.source: The available filters are:
trans-unit.target: The available filters are:

trans-unit.source: **All agreements** shows all licensed software products that are managed by Intune.
trans-unit.target: **All agreements** shows all licensed software products that are managed by Intune.

trans-unit.source: **Volume licensing agreements** shows only Volume Licensing Service Center (VLSC) software products.
trans-unit.target: **Volume licensing agreements** shows only Volume Licensing Service Center (VLSC) software products.

trans-unit.source: **Other software licensing agreements** shows software products that are managed outside of the VLSC.
trans-unit.target: **Other software licensing agreements** shows software products that are managed outside of the VLSC.

trans-unit.source: License Installation Reports
trans-unit.target: License Installation Reports

trans-unit.source: Compare installed software on computers in your organization with your current license agreement coverage, according to the VLSC.
trans-unit.target: Compare installed software on computers in your organization with your current license agreement coverage, according to the VLSC.

trans-unit.source: Filters include:
trans-unit.target: Filters include:

trans-unit.source: **All agreements** shows all licensed software products that are managed by Intune.
trans-unit.target: **All agreements** shows all licensed software products that are managed by Intune.

trans-unit.source: **Volume licensing agreements** shows only VLSC software products.
trans-unit.target: **Volume licensing agreements** shows only VLSC software products.

trans-unit.source: **Other software licensing agreements** shows software products that are managed outside of the VLSC.
trans-unit.target: **Other software licensing agreements** shows software products that are managed outside of the VLSC.

trans-unit.source: Terms and Conditions Reports
trans-unit.target: Terms and Conditions Reports

trans-unit.source: Show whether users accepted the terms and conditions that you deployed, and which version they accepted.
trans-unit.target: Show whether users accepted the terms and conditions that you deployed, and which version they accepted.

trans-unit.source: You can show the acceptance of any terms and conditions that were deployed for up to 10 users, or show the acceptance status for a particular term that was deployed to them.
trans-unit.target: You can show the acceptance of any terms and conditions that were deployed for up to 10 users, or show the acceptance status for a particular term that was deployed to them.

trans-unit.source: Noncompliant Apps Reports
trans-unit.target: Noncompliant Apps Reports

trans-unit.source: Show information about the users who have apps installed that are on your lists of compliant and noncompliant apps.
trans-unit.target: Show information about the users who have apps installed that are on your lists of compliant and noncompliant apps.

trans-unit.source: Use this report to find users and devices that are not in compliance with your company app policies.
trans-unit.target: Use this report to find users and devices that are not in compliance with your company app policies.

trans-unit.source: Certificate Compliance Reports
trans-unit.target: Certificate Compliance Reports

trans-unit.source: Show which certificates have been issued to users and devices through SCEP or PKCS #12 (.PFX).
trans-unit.target: Show which certificates have been issued to users and devices through SCEP or PKCS #12 (.PFX).

trans-unit.source: Use this report to find certificates that are issued, expired, and revoked.
trans-unit.target: Use this report to find certificates that are issued, expired, and revoked.

trans-unit.source: Device History Reports
trans-unit.target: Device History Reports

trans-unit.source: Show a historical log of retire, wipe, and delete actions.
trans-unit.target: Show a historical log of retire, wipe, and delete actions.

trans-unit.source: Use this report to see who initiated actions on devices in the past.
trans-unit.target: Use this report to see who initiated actions on devices in the past.

trans-unit.source: Health Attestation Reports
trans-unit.target: Health Attestation Reports

trans-unit.source: Show the health of mobile devices.
trans-unit.target: Show the health of mobile devices.

trans-unit.source: Mac OS X Hardware Report
trans-unit.target: Mac OS X Hardware Report

trans-unit.source: Displays hardware details for all enrolled Mac OS X devices in the groups that you select.
trans-unit.target: Displays hardware details for all enrolled Mac OS X devices in the groups that you select.

trans-unit.source: For information about the hardware inventory that is collected from these devices, see [Understand your devices with inventory in Microsoft Intune](understand-your-devices-with-inventory-in-microsoft-intune.md).
trans-unit.target: For information about the hardware inventory that is collected from these devices, see [Understand your devices with inventory in Microsoft Intune](understand-your-devices-with-inventory-in-microsoft-intune.md).

trans-unit.source: Mac OS X Software Report
trans-unit.target: Mac OS X Software Report

trans-unit.source: Displays the software that is installed on all Mac OS X devices in the groups that you selected.
trans-unit.target: Displays the software that is installed on all Mac OS X devices in the groups that you selected.

trans-unit.source: The report lists the software name (as a bundle ID), the short version (or friendly) name, the version, and the number of devices with the software installed.
trans-unit.target: The report lists the software name (as a bundle ID), the short version (or friendly) name, the version, and the number of devices with the software installed.

trans-unit.source: To create a report
trans-unit.target: To create a report

trans-unit.source: In the Intune admin console, choose **Reports**.
trans-unit.target: In the Intune admin console, choose **Reports**.

trans-unit.source: Then choose the report type that you want to generate, as described in the previous table.
trans-unit.target: Then choose the report type that you want to generate, as described in the previous table.

trans-unit.source: On the **Create New Report** page, accept the default values, or customize them to filter the results that will be returned by the report.
trans-unit.target: On the **Create New Report** page, accept the default values, or customize them to filter the results that will be returned by the report.

trans-unit.source: For example, you could select that only software published by Microsoft will be displayed in the Detected Software report.
trans-unit.target: For example, you could select that only software published by Microsoft will be displayed in the Detected Software report.

trans-unit.source: Choose **View Report** to open the report in a new window.
trans-unit.target: Choose **View Report** to open the report in a new window.

trans-unit.source: To sort the report by any of the displayed columns, choose the column heading.
trans-unit.target: To sort the report by any of the displayed columns, choose the column heading.

trans-unit.source: Additionally, some reports allow you to expand items in the list to show more detail.
trans-unit.target: Additionally, some reports allow you to expand items in the list to show more detail.

trans-unit.source: More report actions
trans-unit.target: More report actions

trans-unit.source: In addition, reports support the following actions:
trans-unit.target: In addition, reports support the following actions:

trans-unit.source: Action
trans-unit.target: Action

trans-unit.source: More information
trans-unit.target: More information

trans-unit.source: Print
trans-unit.target: Print

trans-unit.source: In an open report, choose the print icon and follow the instructions.
trans-unit.target: In an open report, choose the print icon and follow the instructions.

trans-unit.source: Export
trans-unit.target: Export

trans-unit.source: In an open report, choose the export icon and follow the instructions.
trans-unit.target: In an open report, choose the export icon and follow the instructions.

trans-unit.source: You can export a report to comma-separated values (.csv) or HTML format.
trans-unit.target: You can export a report to comma-separated values (.csv) or HTML format.

trans-unit.source: Save
trans-unit.target: Save

trans-unit.source: On the **Create New Report** page, each user can save up to 100 reports.
trans-unit.target: On the **Create New Report** page, each user can save up to 100 reports.

trans-unit.source: Configure the report parameters to your requirements, and then choose **Save** or **Save As** (if you want to use a different name).
trans-unit.target: Configure the report parameters to your requirements, and then choose **Save** or **Save As** (if you want to use a different name).

trans-unit.source: Load
trans-unit.target: Load

trans-unit.source: On the **Create New Report** page, choose **Load** to retrieve any previously saved sets of report parameters.
trans-unit.target: On the **Create New Report** page, choose **Load** to retrieve any previously saved sets of report parameters.

trans-unit.source: Delete
trans-unit.target: Delete

trans-unit.source: In the **Reports** workspace, select the desired report type and choose **Load**.
trans-unit.target: In the **Reports** workspace, select the desired report type and choose **Load**.

trans-unit.source: Then, in the list of reports, choose the delete (x) icon next to the report.
trans-unit.target: Then, in the list of reports, choose the delete (x) icon next to the report.

trans-unit.source: See also
trans-unit.target: See also

trans-unit.source: Monitoring and reports with Microsoft Intune
trans-unit.target: Monitoring and reports with Microsoft Intune
